Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders, and Martin O’Malley square off on the debate stage for the fourth time Sunday night —  and it’s their last chance to make a final impression on voters before the Iowa caucuses next month.

In their last televised debate before Iowa’s caucuses launch the nominating race on Feb. 1, Clinton raised questions about the   democratic socialist’s positions on Wall Street reform, healthcare and gun control.
